intro: Stenotalis, commonly known as the white-flowered stenotalis, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their finely divided leaves and small, often white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. They are typically found in temperate regions and thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Stenotalis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their delicate appearance and fragrance.
